Okay, I need to create a detailed directory of antique appraisers in Washington, D.C. Let me start by going through the search results provided. 

First, looking at result [2], Prestige Estate Services is mentioned as offering personal property appraisals in Washington, D.C., including antiques. They have a team with Edward Kitson, Elizabeth Lovett, and Stephanie Calman. Their specialties include estate tax, art, and antique appraisals. Contact info is 1-(844) 378-7253 and their website is prestigestateservices.com. They mention IRS compliance and USPAP standards.

Result [6] talks about Doyle‚ÄîDC / Mid-Atlantic location. They are auctioneers and appraisers of fine art and antiques. Their contact is DoyleDC@Doyle.com or 301-348-5282. They have experience with estates like the Kennedy Center chairman's collection.

Result [7] again mentions Prestige Estate Services with more details on their appraisal process: in-person, remote, photo-based options; certified by ISA and ASA; reports for legal/insurance use; cost varies but competitive pricing.

Result [4] discusses Busby Antiques offering in-home appraisals but they're based in Casselberry, FL‚Äîso maybe not relevant for D.C.? But wait the user asked for Washington D.C., so maybe that's a mistake? Or do they serve D.C.? The URL says DC but content mentions FL... Hmm conflicting info here? Need to check if Busby serves DC or if it's an error.

Other results like [1], [3], [5], etc., provide general info on appraisal services but not specific to DC except Prestige and Doyle.

Now compiling the list:

Prestige Estate Services seems solid with multiple mentions ([2], [7]). Then there's Doyle ([6]). Are there others?

Looking at result [9]: Antique Arena offers appraisals at $200/hour but not sure if they're based in DC‚Äîwebsite might be generic? The URL says antiquearena.com/appraisal but no specific location mentioned except travel fees from "our offices"‚Äîbut where are those offices? Not clear if they operate in DC.

Result [8]: Cascade Real Property Appraisal specializes in real estate so probably not relevant for antiques.

So main ones are Prestige Estate Services (Washington-based) and Doyle (DC/Mid-Atlantic). Maybe Busby Antiques isn't actually serving DC despite the URL mentioning it‚Äîmaybe a misindexed page?

For each entry:

Name/Business: Prestige Estate Services
Specialties: Artwork (paintings/sculptures), Antique furniture/jewelry/collectibles
Contact: Phone number from result[2]
Years: Not explicitly stated but "decades of experience" per result[7]
Certs: ISA & ASA certifications

Doyle:
Name/Business: DOYLE ‚Äì DC / Mid-Atlantic
Specialties: Fine art auctions/appraisal including antiques
Contact details from result[6]

Service areas would be Washington D.C., possibly surrounding regions like Georgetown etc.
Pricing ranges from $100-$250/hour as per general info ([1]), while specific ones vary (Antique Arena $200/hr).

Need to structure this into sections as per query requirements.
